title: About
text: Reilley Barish is a University of Nebraska-Lincoln Sophomore. She is a double major in sports media and communication as well as advertising and public relations. She is pursuing a minor in English. Reilley is from Marion, Iowa and grew up a Iowa Hawkeye fan but she now realizes that the Nebraska Cornhuskers are truly the better team. Reilley’s dream job is in social media for a sports team. Knowing data is a big part of the social media world. Here is where Reilley shows off her sports analytic side and how to interpret and understand data.

title: Are Freshman Better at Killing the Ball Versus Seniors in NCAA Volleyball?
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggalt)
library(ggtext)
library(ggrepel)
library(patchwork)
library(waffle)

data <- read_csv ("https://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2023.csv")

year <- data |>
  mutate(yr = factor(yr, levels = c("Fr", "So", "Jr", "Sr","NA")))|>
  select(team, full_name, yr, pos, kills, errors, total_attacks, hit_pct, s) |>
  filter(pos %in% c("OH", "OPP", "RS","MB")) 

avgkills <- data |> summarise(mean(kills))
avgsets <- data |> summarise(mean(s))

custheme <- theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size = 10),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )

fw <- year |>
  filter(s > 68)

#| include: false
ggsave("main.png")


freshman <- year |>
  filter(
    yr == "Fr"
  )
seniors <- year |>
  filter(
    yr== "Sr"
  )
juniors <- year |>
  filter(
    yr == "Jr"
  )
sophomore <- year |>
  filter(
    yr == "So"
  )

avgkillsyr <- year |>
  group_by(yr) |>
  filter(s > 68) |>
  summarize(
    avgkillsyr = mean(kills, na.rm = TRUE)) 

avgtotatt <- year |>
  group_by(yr) |>
  filter(s > 68) |>
  summarize(
    avgtoatt = mean(total_attacks, na.rm = TRUE)) 

fr <- c("Average Kills"=181, "Average Attacks"=513)
sr <- c("Average Kills"=233, "Average Attacks"=616)


Our data is Sports Data Files of the 2023 NCAA volleyball season courtesy of Professor Matt Waite. https://mattwaite.github.io/sportsdatafiles/ncaa_womens_volleyball_playerstats_2023


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_hline(yintercept=632, color="red") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(100,200,300,400,500,600,700), limits = c(0, 700)) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=c(80,100,120), limits = c(68, 131)) +
  geom_line(data=fw, aes(x=s, y=kills, group=yr)) + 
  facet_grid(. ~ yr)+
  geom_hline(yintercept=86.94779, color="blue") +
  labs(
    x="Sets Played", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Seniors Have Proven Why They Deserve Play Time", 
    subtitle="Seniors dominate the total kills category.The <span style = 'color:red;'>red</span> line shows the max total kills by a player. The <span style = 'color:blue;'>blue</span> line shows the average number of kills accross all grades.", 
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Volleyball Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    )+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size = 7),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )


`geom_line()`: Each group consists of only one observation.
ℹ Do you need to adjust the group aesthetic?











Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_hline(yintercept=86.94779, color="blue") + 
  geom_hline(yintercept=632, color="red") +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks=c(200,400,600,800), limits = c(0, 800)) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=c(70,80, 90, 100, 110, 120,130), limits = c(68, 131))+
  geom_line(data=fw, aes(x=s, y=kills, group=yr)) + 
  facet_grid(yr ~ .)+
  labs(
    x="Sets Played", 
    y="Total Kills", 
    title="Seniors Have Proven Why They Deserve Play Time", 
    subtitle="Seniors dominate the total kills category.The <span style = 'color:red;'>red</span> line shows the max total kills by a player. The <span style = 'color:blue;'>blue</span> line shows the average number of kills accross all grades." ,
    caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Volleyball Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
    )+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(size = 7),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
  )


`geom_line()`: Each group consists of only one observation.
ℹ Do you need to adjust the group aesthetic?











Code
bc1 <-ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=year,
    aes(x=s, y=kills, size=yr), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.3)+
  geom_point(
    data = freshman,
    aes(x = s, y = kills, size = yr),
    color = "red"
  ) +
   geom_vline(xintercept = 68.59631) +
   geom_hline(yintercept = 86.94779) +
  labs(
    x = "Sets Played",
    y = "Total Kills",
    title = "Freshman Are Not to the Same Level as Seniors ",
    subtitle = "2023 was the year of the incoming freshman though many placed pressure onto the players to perform."
  ) +
  custheme




Code
bc2<-ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=year,
    aes(x=s, y=kills, size=yr), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.3)+
  geom_point(
    data = seniors,
    aes(x = s, y = kills, size = yr),
    color = "blue"
  ) +
   geom_vline(xintercept = 68.59631) +
   geom_hline(yintercept = 86.94779) +
  labs(
    x = "Sets Played",
    y = "Total Kills",
    caption = "Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish")+
  custheme

bc1 + bc2


Warning: Using size for a discrete variable is not advised.

(`geom_point()`).

(`geom_point()`).











Code
bc3 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=year,
    aes(x=s, y=kills, size=yr), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.3)+
  geom_point(
    data = sophomore,
    aes(x = s, y = kills, size = yr),
    color = "pink"
  ) +
   geom_vline(xintercept = 68.59631) +
   geom_hline(yintercept = 86.94779) +
  labs(
    x = "Sets Played",
    y = "Total Kills",
    title = "Sophomores versus Juniors",
    subtitle = "How the two middle grades measure up to each other."
  ) +
  custheme




Code
bc4 <-ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=year,
    aes(x=s, y=kills, size=yr), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.3)+
  geom_point(
    data = juniors,
    aes(x = s, y = kills, size = yr),
    color = "darkgreen"
  ) +
   geom_vline(xintercept = 68.59631) +
   geom_hline(yintercept = 86.94779) +
  labs(
    x = "Sets Played",
    y = "Total Kills",
    caption = "Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Player Stats | By Reilley Barish"
  ) +
  custheme
bc3+bc4

Code
fr5 <- c("Average Kills"=181, "Average Attacks"=513, 155)
sr5 <- c("Average Kills"=233, "Average Attacks"=616)

iron(
 waffle(fr5/5, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="1 square = 5 kills", 
        colors = c("red", "black", "white")
        )+
   labs(
     x="Freshman",
     title="Seniors Tend to Need More Attacks to Kill a Ball ", 
     subtitle="Freshman's pure power and youthful energy makes it easier to put balls down.") + 
   theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 10),
    axis.title.y = element_blank()
  ),
 waffle(sr5/5, 
        rows = 10, 
        xlab="1 square = 5 kills", 
        colors = c("blue", "black")
        )+
   labs(
     x = "Senior\n1 Square = 5 Kills or Attacks",
     caption="Source: Matt Waite Github: 2023 NCAA Volleyball Player Stats | Graphic by Reilley Barish"))
